summary: Workflow timer debouncing fails when attempting to cancel and re-launch timers in response to signals. The workflow gets stuck in Running state instead of properly resetting the timer, causing roadrunner errors about undefined requests.
userImpact: Users cannot implement debounce-like patterns for workflows that need to repeatedly cancel and restart timers based on signals, limiting workflow design capabilities.
rootCause: The workflow execution engine has issues handling rapid timer cancellation and re-launching in awaitWithTimeout when triggered by signals, resulting in orphaned request IDs that don't match responses.
workaround: Implement updatable timer logic by tracking awake time in a variable and checking it after each awakening with Workflow::timer instead of repeatedly terminating and re-launching awaitWithTimeout.
keyQuote: Workflow jams in Running state instead of timer cancellation and then resetting another one.
